title: Anthropologie is Type sensitive.
content:
Has anyone else seen this? I am thinking of buying some dinnerware from this collection. They have more stuff at in store locations, i.e. large sans serif wall decorations and monogram coat hooks. Take a look-see.

[Bookhand Monogram Glasses and such](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007003023/http:/www.anthropologie.com/anthro/catalog/productdetail.jsp?cross-sell=true&color=one&navAction=jump&id=780233)

 [‹ Academic writing and font setting.](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007003023/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41644 "Go to previous forum topic") [Reasons to use Flickr ? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007003023/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41084 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Wesley.Bancroft

comments.content: Shweet. Now if only Martha Stewart would commission H&F-J to do a typeface for some custom dinnerware.

Fishs Eddy has been selling [some alphabet mugs](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007003023/http:/www.fishseddy.com/browse.cfm/2,7.html) for a while... spotted them in one of their store windows a few months ago.
